title: Tuscan Bread Salad
introduction: Perfect for any summer day, Tuscan Bread Salad, also known as Panzanella, emphasizes the crisp and chewy texture of day-old bread mixed with fresh, vibrant ingredients. Ripe tomatoes, crunchy celery, and aromatic basil come together in harmony, soaked in a tangy dressing, offering a delightful burst of flavors with each bite.
ingredients: 6 to 8 slices day-old country-style Italian bread
2 ripe tomatoes, cut into bite-size pieces
1/2 cup fresh basil leaves, torn into bits
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Place the bread in a large serving bowl and sprinkle with the water. Let stand 1 hour. Squeeze out the excess water, and wipe out the bowl. Tear the bread into bits, returning them to the bowl.

Add the tomatoes, celery, onion, and basil. Toss well. In a small bowl, whisk together the oil, vinegar, and salt and pepper to taste. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss again. Cover and let stand in a cool place 1 hour.
Toss the salad, and taste and adjust the seasoning. Serve immediately.
variations: Cucumbers and radishes can also be added for extra crunch and flavor.
